WorkItem.ClosedComment: Because, as we've explained over and over again, the version with the fix is not RELEASED yet. And even if it was HUNTER IS BORKED. It's not set up for Cataclysm.
WorkItem.Description:
I cant load hunter via website or via Offline, same message appears in Fire Fox and IE,i have tried all the fixes i could,i installed off line as well as online, installed new silver-light cleared cache etc. here is what it is saying i can load mage etc but not hunter Help lol!
 
Error message is =
[Argument_AddingDuplicate]
Arguments: 
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=4.0.60129.0&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=Argument_AddingDuplicate

WorkItem.Summary: [Hunter] Needs Help Please, I Need This Addon

Comments.Message:
Would people PLEASE search for existing Issues before posting!

This has already been reported (multiple times) and fixed.  Been reported in:
Item# 20542
Item# 20532
Item# 20523
Item# 20492
Item# 20434
but if it has been fixed...how come so many of us hunters keep on getting the same error?

Recommend the devs take the time to add code to do an internal check on the character being loaded and if it's an unsupported class, refuse to load it and toss up a modal dialog box with the information - then it can't be ignored. Need me to submit a patch to do that?

Mithelen, when the Devs says "fixed", it generally means "fixed for the next release".  That means if you can compile the source code yourself, the fix will be in place.  Otherwise, you have to wait until the next version is released (apply's to both Online and Downloadable versions).
Markdall, when you first load Rawr, on the Welcome Screen there is a list of the models status (as well as in the bottom right corner of the screen if you are already in the module).  Hunter (and Elemental) is listed as inoperable (or non-functional).  I believe that is sufficient warning that you shouldn't be using this module.  If you want to submit a patch (for anything), feel free, but it may not be accepted.

Meh. It's clearly not sufficient warning, but if you guys want to keep having people bother you, that's your business. You're right about the patches though. I once submitted a patch that would let you copy to the clipboard a list of just the crap that had changed - as in, "To meet what Rawr is telling you to do, go buy the following gems". It got denied with the explanation that the Silverlight version would handle that. Guess what the Silverlight version doesn't handle. oh well.
